paragraph: Florian Ross (born 1972) is a German jazz pianist, composer and arranger.

Ross was born in Pforzheim in 1972. His debut recording as leader was made for Naxos Records in 1998 â€“ Seasons & Places. In 2011, he was commissioned to write a new arrangement of a Bobby Wellins composition for the Scottish National Jazz Orchestra. Ross released Ties & Loose Ends, his first recording of his own big band project, in 2013. In the same year, the Florian Ross Elektrio, featuring the leader on Hammond B3 organ, was released.
An asterisk (*) indicates that the year is that of release.
